means: 按等级划分的，等级（制度）的

sentence.Network_en: But the problems of perpetuating a hierarchical society go deeper than this.
sentence.Network_cn: 但是把等级社会永久化的问题却比这深刻得多.

sentence.Network_en: The appellation stuck , and the age of the sequential hierarchical menu began.
sentence.Network_cn: 其名称也从中而来, 于是顺序层次关系菜单时代开始了.

sentence.Network_en: Congress is a collegial and not a hierarchical body.
sentence.Network_cn: 国会是一个学院式的机构,而不是一个等级制度的机构.

entry.tran: 等级制度的;等级森严的
entry.def: A hierarchical system or organization is one in which people have different ranks or positions, depending on how important they are.

example.ex: ...the traditional hierarchical system of military organization.
example.tran: 军事组织内传统的等级制度

means.word_mean: 1. classified according to various criteria into successive levels or layers;

sentences.sentence: "it has been said that only a hierarchical society with a leisure class at the top can produce works of art"
"in her hierarchical set of values honesty comes first"
